properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed for the Beach2Beach fun run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 5,000 participants will take part in the annual Beach2Beach Charity Fun Run and Festival from Dee Why to Newport. Events start from 8am and will finish at around 1pm at Newport Beach. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants. Access for local residents will be maintained when safe to do so after runners have safely passed by along the course.

  • Collaroy from 7am to 9:30am: Sections of Beach Road and Florence Avenue will be closed to general traffic.
  • Warriewood/Mona Vale from 7.30am to 11am:
  • Narrabeen Park Parade southbound lanes will be closed between Cook Terrace and Sydney Road, Warriewood. One-way traffic northbound only will be maintained.
  • Sections of Melbourne Avenue, Basset Street, Orana Road and Surfview Road will be closed.
  • Peal Place and Bruce Street will be under managed access for residents via Narrabeen Park Parade northbound.
  • Mona Vale from 7.30am to 12pm: Grandview Parade will be closed between Orana Road and Barrenjoey Road.
  • Newport from 7.30am to 12:30pm: Sections of Ross Street, Palm Road and Myola Road around the Beach will be closed.

Southbound lane closures and a reduced speed limit of 40km/h will also be in place on sections of Barrenjoey Road and Pittwater Road while the event takes place.

Special event clearways will be in place from 4am to midday on the eastern side of Barrenjoey Road between Palm Road (Newport) and Grandview Parade (Mona Vale), and from 4am to 9:30am on the eastern side of Pittwater Road between Anzac Avenue (Collaroy) and Hawkesbury Avenue (Dee Why).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopen after cleaning  


COLLAROY – FROM 7AM TO 9.30AM

  • Beach Rd* between Anzac Ave and Collaroy Beach
  • Florence Ave* from Beach Rd

WARRIEWOOD/MONA VALE – FROM 7:30AM TO 11AM

  • Bruce St and Pearl Pl will be under managed access from Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Melbourne Ave^^ between Cook Tce and Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Narrabeen Park Parade** between Cook Tce and Sydney Rd (south) (Southbound)
  • Peal Pl - managed access from Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Bassett St* From Orana Rd (Eastbound)
  • Orana Rd^ between Bassett St and Grandview Pde (Northbound)
  • Surfview Rd* between Bassett St and Seabeach Ave
  • Surfview Rd* From Darley St E to end of street

MONA VALE – FROM 7:30AM TO 12PM

  • Grandview Pde^ between Barrenjoey Rd and Orana Rd (Eastbound)

NEWPORT – FROM 7:30AM TO 12.30PM

Restricted access is in place from Barrenjoey Rd northbound to Newport Beach and on the eastern side of Barrenjoey Rd between Karloo Parade and The Boulevarde. Residents are advised to expect minor delays.

  • Myola Rd* between Ross St and Palm Rd (Southbound)
  • Palm Rd* between Barrenjoey Rd and Myola Rd (Westbound)
  • Ross St* between Bramley Ave and Myola Rd (Northbound)

NOTES:

*Managed access for residents will be in place and minor delays expected.

^Resident will have access via Bassett St and should expect minor delays.

**Residents will have access via Narrabeen Park Parade in the northbound direction.

^^Route Buses excepted.


LANE CLOSURES – BARRENJOEY ROAD

Managed access for residents will be in place with minor delays expected. Temporary lane closures will be progressively reopen after cleaning.


COLLAROY TO DEE WHY

  • FROM 6AM TO 10AM: Pittwater Rd Between Anzac Ave and Hawkesbury Ave – Lane 1 & 2

NEWPORT TO MONA VALE

  • 6AM TO 11AM: Barrenjoey Rd between Hillcrest Ave and Grandview Pde – Lane 1 & 2 (Southbound)
  • 6AM TO 12PM: Barrenjoey Rd between Palm Rd and Grandview Pde – Lane 1 (Southbound)

40KM/H SPEED REDUCTION

A reduced speed limit of 40km/h will apply in the following areas to ensure the safety of runners:

  • 6AM TO 10AM: Pittwater Rd Between Anzac Ave and Hawkesbury Ave
  • 6AM TO 12PM: Barrenjoey Rd between between The Boulevard and Grandview Pde (Southbound)

arrangementElements.html:

  • Barrenjoey Rd between Palm Rd and Grandview Pde (Eastern side)

COLLAROY TO DEE WHY - FROM 4AM TO 9:30AM

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearway

roads.mainStreet: Pittwater Road, Ocean Street and Barrenjoey Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL & NRLW Double Header: Sharks v Knights at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Jersey Flegg kick-off at 11.30am, NRLW kick-off at 1.45pm, NRL kick-off 4.05pm full time around 5.45pm.

Road closures may be in place on Captain Cook Dr from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared around 30 minutes after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

NRLW: Wests Tigers v Eels at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 6.10pm, full time around 8.10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice: The Muswellbrook Vietnam Remembrance Day Service will be held on Sunday 18 August from 2.30pm to 5pm. Traffic control will be in place, along with a 40km/hr speed restriction for the safety of motorists and pedestrians.

The Gunnedah AgQuip Show will be held from Tuesday 20 to Thursday 22 August.

There will be 40km/hr speed restrictions in place on the Kamilaroi Highway between Stockmans Close and Mathias Road and on the Oxley Highway between Barlow Road and View Street. There will be 80km/hr speed restrictions between Wilkinsons Road and the Kamilaroi Highway.

Motorists should expect delays on approaches to the site and follow the direction of traffic controllers.

properties.publicTransport: Additional buses will run between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Some buses will be using different stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 40,000 people are expected to attend the annual Festival of the Winds at Bondi Beach from 11am to 4pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in place at Bondi Beach and Bondi Junction.

Traffic will be very heavy on approaches to Bondi including Bondi Rd, Syd Einfeld Dr, Old South Head Rd and Military Rd as well as local roads around Bondi Beach. Motorists are advised to avoid non-essential travel or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures

  • From 10am to 6pm: roads around Bondi Junction Interchange will be closed including sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St, Oxford St and Grosvenor Lane. 
  • Access to the Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Dr carparks will be managed under traffic control from 5am to 6pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 7pm on both sides of Bondi Rd between Old South Head Rd and Sandridge St, as well as sections of Campbell Pde and Hall St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BONDI JUNCTION – FROM 10AM TO 6PM

  • Grafton Street between Grosvenor Street and Newland Street (westbound)
  • Grosvenor Street between Spring Street and Grafton Street (both directions)
  • Grosvenor Lane* between Newland Street and Grosvenor Street (both directions)
  • Oxford Street between Adelaide Street and Grosvenor Street (both directions)

Note: *Resident access permitted.


MANAGED ACCESS - BONDI BEACH – FROM 5AM TO 6PM

Access will be managed at the following locations by traffic controllers, follow directions and allow extra time.

  • Park Drive South from Beach Road to southern end of carpark
  • Queen Elizabeth Drive at Campbell Parade

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

BONDI / BONDI BEACH – FROM 7AM TO 7PM

  • Bondi Road between Old South Head Road and opposite Sandridge Street (Northern side)
  • Bondi Road between Sandridge Street and Oxford Street (Southern side)
  • Campbell Parade between Hall Street and Roscoe Street (Western side)
  • Campbell Parade Between Queen Elizabeth Drive (northern end exit) and Queen Elizabeth Drive (southern end - entrance) (eastern side)
  • Hall Street between Gould Street and Campbell Parade (Both sides)
arrangementElements.title: Road closures and Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Sea Eagles at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 7:50pm and full time around 8:40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the event during evening peak.

A section of Mary Street will close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel Street while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Knights at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 5:10pm, NRL kick-off at 7:35pm, full time around 9.15pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the match. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Dog and Cat Lovers Festival at Sydney Showground on Saturday and Sunday from 9:30am to 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the expo. Travel with your group and allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd.

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.  

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map for more details.  ﻿

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW: Wests Tigers v Broncos at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 1:45pm and full time around 3:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the event.

A section of Mary Street will close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel Street while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NSW Half Marathon will be taking place at Sydney Olympic Park. Half marathon starts at 6:30am, 10km starts at 8:40am and Family Fun run starts at 9:15am.

Roads around Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the event from 1:30am to 1pm including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave and Olympic Blvd, and from 4am to 12pm including sections of Kevin Coombes Ave and Australia Ave.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while paricipants travel to and from the precinct.

For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

arrangementElements.html:
From 1:30am to 1pm

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Showground Road to Edwin Flack Avenue
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliot Ave to Kevin Coombs Avenue

From 4am to 12pm

  • Kevin Coombes/Marjorie Jackson Avenue between Pondage Link and Bennelong Parkway
  • Australia Avenue/Holker Busway from Grand Parade to Hill Road
arrangementElements.title: Road closures

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL & NRLW Dragons Double Header at WIN Stadium. NRL kick off at 4:05pm, NRLW kick off at 6:10pm, full time at around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Roadwork: Fans driving home from the game are advised that there will be a full closure of the M1 Princes Motorway, Mount Ousley Road, at the intersection with the M1 and Picton Road. For more details visit the Live Traffic entry.

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
BStreetSmart 2024 at Qudos Bank Arena. Tuesday 20, Wednesday 21 and Thursday 22 August from 9:15am until 3.30pm daily.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Olympic Boulevard will be partially closed from 8:30am until approximately 2:30pm during the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Adelaide Crows at the SCG. First bounce at 7.40pm, full time around 10.20pm.

With more than 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be very heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 4.45pm and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 4.45pm.
  • To support the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Road onto Moore Park Road westbound. Motorists can use Cook Road for access onto Moore Park Road instead. 

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St, Fitzroy St and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

From 3pm to midnight

  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)  
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side) 
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Fremantle Dockers (Walyalup) at ENGIE Stadium. First Bounce at 1.45pm, full time around 4.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the match. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Rabbitohs at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 7.35pm, full time around 9.35pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of fans are expected to travel to Mundiville, 40km west of Broken Hill past Silverton for the annual Mundi Mundi Bash from 15 to 17August.

Traffic may be heavier than usual through Broken Hill and along the Barrier Highway throughout the festival.

The Mundi Mundi Lookout of Wilangee Rd (approx 5km north of Silverton village) will be closed from Sunday 11 August to Monday 18 August from 6am to 6pm for safety reasons. The closure removes congestion and liklihood of collisions by preventing road users from entering and exiting the lookout.

properties.publicTransport: Buses are diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 100,000 people are expected to attend the Ferragosto Italian Street Festival in Five Dock today, from 10am to 5pm.

Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions are in place for the festival.

  • Great North Rd is closed between Queens Rd and Lyons Rd from 3am until 11pm. Other local roads are also closed.
  • Motorists will be diverted around the closure via Lyons Rd, Ingham Ave, Fairlight St, Queens Rd and Harris Rd.
  • Special event clearways are in effect from 2am to 11pm on both sides of Great North Rd between Queens Rd and Lyons Rd, as well as on sections of surrounding streets.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

Bus services may be modified or diverting, and some stops will be missed.

Light Rail L2 and L3 services will also be affected.

Visit transport.info for more information.

NRL & NRLW Dragons Double Header at WIN Stadium. NRLW: Dragons v Roosters kick off at 12pm, NRL: Dragons v Titans kick off at 2pm, full time at around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Roadwork: Fans driving home from the game are advised that there will be a full closure of the M1 Princes Motorway, Mount Ousley Road, at the intersection with the M1 and Picton Road. For more details visit the Live Traffic entry.
